alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 7:52AM CDT until May 27 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Goodland KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se, Stratton, Benkelman 1sw...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Republican River At Stratton. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 12.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM CDT.
